name: Zeno Clash
description: Zeno Clash is an action/fighting game set in a punk fantasy world. The game is played from a first person perspective and the combat is generally up close and brutal. Experience a deep storyline set in a fantastic world.
minimum_requirements: Minimum                     Operating System: Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / Vista64                     Processor: Intel® Pentium® 4 3.0 GHz                     Memory: 1 GB RAM                     Hard Disk Space: At least 3 GB of free space                     Video Card: 128 MB, Shader model 2.0, ATI 9600, NVidia 6600 or better                     Sound Card: DirectX® 9.0c compatible sound card                     DirectX® Version: DirectX® 9.0c, DirectX® 10
recommended_requirements: Recommended                     Operating System: Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / Vista64                     Processor: Intel® core 2 duo 2.4GHz                      Memory: 1 GB RAM                     Hard Disk Space: At least 3 GB of free space                     Video Card: Shader model 3.0, NVidia 7600, ATI X1600 or better                      Sound Card: DirectX® 9.0c compatible sound card                     DirectX® Version: DirectX® 9.0c, DirectX® 10                     Controller: Supported

reviews.review_text: If you always wanted to punch a four-breasted anthropomorphic rat in the face, this is the game for you.

This game has vivid and imaginative visuals going for it.  But is otherwise let down by a boring, uninspiring and pretentiously written story.  That and the game is a chore to play, with little satisfaction to be had from vanquishing your foes. The tedious fights feel like a punishment and distraction from the not as unpleasant cut-scenes.  It's worth a look for its originality but has little redeeming value otherwise.

Very strange, to be honest, I thought someone dosed me with something, I had to ask and confirm with other people that this game was real. The gameplay at its heart is a first person brawler, with a healthy mix up of shooting here and there. but the story, woa ho ho.... man. imagine a world that was generations deep with inbreeding, as well as cross breeding with chickens and pigs, and not the cute jrpg way, but more of a demented master blaster way. This is the world you're going to get into with this game.  I did not like the melee combat at first, but the story kept me playing, and I ended up finding that the parry hit and run knee to the face smash tactics to be, well....... really good. and by the end of the game I found myself actually wanting to toss my guns down and put my fists up. It's short, but left me satisfied. I hope we see more of this twisted world.

I'm going to give the controversial opinion and say that I didn't really enjoy this game.  The first person combat is amazing, yes. I love the way that the first person fighting mechanics feel. But the story just could not hold my interest.  The world you are put in is such an interesting and creative one, yet the plot is so jointed and disconnected that I never felt like I got to know the world very well. The story and plot was just too confusing for me to understand. Many aspects just felt unexplained, and the game ends on a sequel hook cliffhanger.  Is the game worth trying? Sure. But personally? I felt the confusing story made the game drag on far too long.
Am I a bad person to like this game so much?

absurdism is difficult. that which is otherworldly, that which is abstract understanding, can only stem from relations of relations of corrupted understandings. people gravitate toward things far removed from understanding. people talk and caw about games having disparate worlds, but zeno clash is true. zeno clash features a world so far removed from anything in fiction or in living. its an absolute triumph of visual direction. zeno clash is a textbook on the deranged. with all of my praise though, it does remind one distinctly of oddworld. however, zeno clash’s world is much more lively - less barren to say - and there are many humans. though there are many other creatures as well.  whatever zeno clash ended up looking like, the base idea is something I would sell myself off for. I am incredibly glad this game exists. beat ‘em ups are eternal for me. what rings incredibly true for zeno clash is how traditional it is. you fight with two kinds of punches, light and heavy. a light punch can strike up to three times and can be comboed into a strong. strong punches are kind of like a wind up punch; space yourself away from your target and dash in with your fist. both are incredibly satisfying thanks to impeccable animation and hit detection. if an enemy becomes dazed, they can be thrown. and that’s basically it. the basic tendency calls back the roots of the beat ‘em up genre, a very comfortable thing for me, and a very different trace of influence for a modern game. especially considering the direction beat ‘em ups have taken with devil may cry, ninja gaiden, and god of war - although those are fantastic titles - it’s nice to see a game toning things back. except, I’d probably enjoy a hyper-complex combat system more, in all honesty.  if zeno clashed revolved around limited arena battles punching the trash out of fugly foes, and in saying that it does anyway, then it’d be a fantastic game that anyone looking for new ideas in their vidcons should play. it wouldn’t raise any intellectual hell, but exist as something more primal than serious sam, with an even goofier atmosphere. the boxing arenas are still totally worth it. but what was a successful formula gets bogged down by forced variance. ace team wasn’t content with the gold they struck - or maybe the gold was struck from altering their original first person shooter formula? either way, there are guns in the game. shoehorned guns. guns that are not fun to shoot or use. if they were options to use in the battle royals then they would be tarnishing, but forgivable. they are not. the gunplay is forced numerous times. thankfully they are not long, yet the damage is still felt. it’s not like anything is broken with the guns - it’s just they’re incredibly mediocre compared to your fists. the endworld is an exception to that with interesting and fun ranged combat. though pacing of using a magic wand leaves some to be desired and the enemies you fight are nothing more than zombies, it’s still darkly enchanting.  ranged weapons present one problem and melee weapons present another. melee weapons have a light swing and a heavy swing, much like your hands. once again, they function like they always have in the genre. they’re usually satisfying to use and offer a break from cracking skulls with your knuckles all day. the problem isn’t in the melee weapons, but when you’re given them. not too often can you use them against normal facepunchers. heavyweight enemies can only be damaged and toppled by heavy weapons and only the charge attack really does any damage. this leads to very mediocre and unsatisfying fights. there are no gambits allowed, no subcombos to pull off, no variety to speak of. you distance yourself, wind up attack, strafe, bash, retreat, repeat. and zeno clash will just throw these fatties at you as the game progresses. they’ll be one with small guys, one coming right after another, and at one point in the game two at a time. the two at a time encounter is pretty damn cool honestly. still, they are static and unfun encounters, and drag down what should be the pinnacle of the game.  if zeno clash had a more organic presentation it would be legendary. if you traversed large and odd levels, fisting waves of enemies, it would have ascended. even if it had rather linear levels with stop and fight sequences, it still would have delivered a wholly amazing game. instead you’re more often that not pitted in smallish arenas to fight your rounds. there are more traditional fps orientated levels to be found, but in those you do not punch, which is all the more confusing. levels are relegated to being plot excerpts filled with gameplay, instead of having the plot compliment the gameplay. its pacing is haphazard and disappointing. it wants to have this grand adventure and yet its levels are arcade in nature. not like double dragon arcade, but dig-dug. they’re just rounds. that feeling is even more horribly accented in the second half when you repeat most of the places you already walked through on your return trip home, just with harder enemies.  sheer repetition is zeno clash’s greatest flaw. guns are no different from eachother besides how many bullets sit in the chamber. melee weapons offer no variation aside from different looking skins. both guns and weapons have wonderful models, but that’s not the kind of variation I’m vying for. there are many different and awesome looking enemies. those many different awesome looking enemies will be fought two to even three times each. their names are the same, I guess they are the same people, but when you fight the same enemies in the same level as a few hours before it feels really freaking lazy. with the two bounty hunter confrontations, both very great despite relying on poor gunplay, it’s more than obvious that ace team really wanted variation in their game. so the design choices in the meat of their game sit in ugly defiance to their vision. a real frustrating execution overall.  writing is stilted. purposefully, the characters need to assume their roles as midsavages. there is a mighty depth and conviction to the script. made up words and made up accents. though, the voice acting does not match the quality of writing, and is rather poor. the story itself, framed as a mystery, compliments the game’s piecemeal length. when it’s all said and done though the plot is a bit flat. it’s not really about what ghat did so much as ghat dealing with why he did it. with the characters being in a generally unrelatable state of mind, the implications aren’t so interesting to learn about. what’s great about the script is the weird things, the corwids, father-mother’s society, the endworld, golem’s crypticness. these things really draw you in. it succeds in vision and skill of writing even if it does not have the running time to tell a deep story.  zeno clash is an addled burst of fraught strangeness smoothed with brand new gameplay. its short length makes it very easy to recommend, but it also is its greatest limiter with unrealized ideas all over the place. zeno clash is a small game and isn’t content with it. because of that, I’m not exactly content with it either.
One of the most unique and focused games I have played. I really enjoyed my time with it. 10/10

Definitely not my thing.  The setting intrigued me initially and I love the world it's set in, but as a game, it's essentially street fighter with bird people.  That's not to say the game is bad, It's just not something I would play repeatedly.  I long ago stopped playing combat-centric games.  As this game goes, it has FANTASTIC combat.  If you like focusing on which attack to choose on a particular opponent, you will like this game. A lot.  You will like it doubly if you're into post-apocalytic dystopain sci-fi stories.  I wish they'd expounded on the world they had created more, but I highly recommend this game, despite not being a huge fan of the genre.

Pros: Unique Setting Interesting Story Fantastic art direction (the animals have ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s!) Unique Weapons Melee combat and guns Source engine (that's right, 299 fps limit!)  Neutral: Short (~3 hours) Voice acting is pretty hit or miss  Cons: Repetitive Somewhat cheap difficulty near the end  Recommended during sale.
Imagination thy recreation? Zeno Clash thy destination.

A true hidden gem that deserves so much more recognition. I haven't seen such hauntingly alien landscapes and settings since Morrowind, the visual desing in this game is excellent with every location being memorable and every character becoming quickly recognizable at a glance. The combat is fresh, easy to learn but difficult to master and very satisfying which is amazing when you consider this is a first person fighting game! Even the plot feels like something vibrant and different, while fairly simple and some what predictable, you are presented with a rich and detailed world that oozes life and history but never feels the need to bog things down explaining itself.   The closest thing I can think of to bring up as criticism is that the sound design is very lacking, the music is so forgettable that it may as well not be there and the voice actors seem strictly amateur. It's also very short, there is some replay value with multiple endings and a challenge mode but it's still only a few afternoons worth of play. These are however very minor flaws in an otherwise beautiful game.  At the price this goes for during sales you owe it to yourself to experience this.
Strange but great game with nice story and weird characters <3
Unique world and story, fun game overall and costs only 0.99 when it's on sale!

This game is awesome.   The combat is brutal, satisfying, and easy to learn, gameplay is well paced, and the graphics use the source engine, so you don't need a beastly computer for this game to run smoothly and look great.  The storyline is original and engaging, and will keep you interested. At 4 to 5 hours of play it isn't very long, but for the price they're asking it is a bargain. It's a surreal, exciting adventure in a mysterious world that will keep you hooked until it's over.   Buy this game now, did I mention it's awesome?

Short but perfectly proportioned. Something you play for the 'experience' rather than the game play (which tbh probably couldn't sustain anything longer than the 3-4 hours it'll take you to finish it.) Occasionally floaty and unresponsive controls, but the visuals are weird and wonderful, and the story is compelling and original. Definitly pick it up if you see it in the steam sale bargain bin.
Ever been on so many drugs that you see a hermaphrodite bird like creature trying to kill you? Zeno clash.

pros:  unique world with some unique lifeforms   cons:  short (3 hours top) super linear the constant gitteriness of the camera while fighting gave me a headache weapons are aweful, might as well stick to fists story is lacking and obvious rehash fights with the same few characters over and over

TL;DR – The most this caveman brawler gives you in terms of plot and setting exposition is a moderately-short blurb on the game’s store page. Also, one of the enemy models closely resembles a *ToTaLLy MEtAl* version of the Swedish Chef from “The Muppet Show”. Recommend.   Onto the review:  It’s actually to Zeno Clash’s benefit that it doesn’t really explain itself outside of the basic gameplay mechanics, which are simplistic but nevertheless require a bit of finesse if you’re playing on any of the higher difficulties. To elaborate, combat is your typical mouse-bound primary-light-attack, secondary-heavy-attack affair, utilizing the spacebar for blocking and evading. Uncoordinated lout that I am, this was interpreted as “spam the secondary/primary and run around like a chicken sans head”. This 'style' of gameplay actually worked for me, thanks to the normal-level difficulty setting I was playing on, in addition to smartly-placed health items in each area.   Unfortunately, this is also the likely cause of the game’s growing tediousness later on, as, outside of a few close calls and even some deaths, I was just smashing through opponents in area after area. To offset this, there is some variety in the stages; for example, a brawling sequence being followed by a shooting gallery level, or some other contrivance (like using a magic torch to light up pyres and moving statues alike). And the guns, oh the guns.   Indeed, the weapons in Zeno Clash most succinctly sum up the game’s overall art aesthetic; the closest comparison in décor is that of “The Flintstones”, with its brightly-colored yet naturalistic designs. Hell, there’s even dinosaurs (or at least large reptiles resembling them) in a level or two. The guns themselves specifically piqued my interest, as the idea of a primeval-era slugthrower is just surreally fantastic. For example, the pistols, which basically appear to be carved shells with a bunch of nails and rocks stuffed into them, are just fun to look at and use in all of their pea-shootery goodness (which may also explain why I keep running into the same named characters again after I so thoroughly obliterate their asses).   Besides the art design, this sense of backwards absurdity is ingrained in the plot and characters; outside of the aftermentioned blurb, the game leaves it up to the progression of the narrative itself to explain what the hell is going on, eking out small bits of info through dialogue and actions. It's a refreshing break from grandiose blocks of text that describe a game's lore in exacting detail, but I fear the world of Zeno Clash might still be too alien to experience without detailed explanation for some players. At the same time however, it's that same feeling of unknowingness that may spur other players (myself included) to push on and immerse themselves in the absolute weirdness that is this game.   Final words: Zeno Clash is so aesthetically 'out there' that it may dissuade players from digging into it, but the fairly-conventional combat system, in addition to a relatable (if somewhat vague) storyline, signifies that this 5ish-hour-long brawler is still worth playing for a couple of bucks.
Great game. FPS brawler excellence.
Boring, monotonous game. Unlike the sequel its dull and lifeless.  Combat mechanics are the only one You can rely on, but that's not how You should spend Your money.

People need to understand that 'weird'story doesnt make it good (this is terrible in my opinion), I found the story very lacking ,my character motivations are absent,the game feel clumsy , the voice acting is terrible and so is the gameplay.   This is just a first person meele brawler with boring and repetitive gameplay that tries to compensate all his shortcoming with a strange story which is boring,unprovoking,poorly delivered,but because most people wont recognize a good plot,they think strange=good. I buy this at 90% discount (1 dolar) And I feel I wasted my money.

This is the best beat em up game ever, the story is amazing and something that everyone will enjoy if they enjoy these types of games, I recommend this game to anyone who loves a good storyline and something to beat up in combat.
Interesting game that got boring quick. I had no idea what was going on and the world itself is just strange. Never really got into it and never will. Dumb ♥♥♥ game
Interesting game that got boring quick. I had no idea what was going on and the world itself is just strange. Never really got into it and never will. Dumb ♥♥♥ game
Worst hitbox ever.

Oh man what an awesome thing Zeno Clash was. 'Was'? Yes, was. Because they made a sequel which was sort of terrible.  That doesn't mean you can't enjoy Zeno Clash, though. It's a fine first person brawler in which you punch bird-people in the beak. The art is gorgeous and weird as ♥♥♥♥, the story makes incredibly little sense and the characters are hilarious.   So what are you doing still reading this review? Go play Zeno Clash you worthless kak!!

An enjoyable (if slightly clunky) first-person shooter/brawler/bomb-thrower/man-crow-puncher hybrid. The setting is intriguing and levels are varied. The story has enough meat on the bones to keep things interesting while still peppering in enough mysteries to carry you through to the end.
Got about an hour into this, and even with my low quality tolerance this was terrible. Atmosphere was interesting but that is all it had going for it. 2/10

A very average action-arcade game where you fight with fists. The gameplay is quite unique, albeit get repetitive rather quickly. The story is terrible, so are characters, but who cares anyway. I think some action games fans might enjoy Zeno Clash, but for most it will be an average game like it is for me, hence I do not really recommend it.
This game is really good, i never saw so good graphics in FPF ( First Person Fighting ) but i is a little hard to fight the bosses and understand the game too
Bad & bugged gameplay. Horrible voice recording & mixing. Avoid it at all cost.
It's an interesting concept: take the Half-Life Engine, and re-work it to make a first-person fighting game. However, the story is weak, and the level design is far too linear for my taste.
This game is good,go get it, it also has 4 boob ladies

Pretty fun. The fighting mechanic takes some getting used to, and even then can be a little cumbersome, but it's fun. For running under the Source Engine, the graphics are amazing, especially when it comes to the depth of field effect. The storyline at first makes no sense, but in the end it actually comes together as a very well written game. The only cons of this game are the length and the voice acting. It doesn't take too long, and if you sit down for a while you can probably get it done in a day. The voice acting, I'm not sure if it's purposely bad or not. In a game like this, it may be purposely fake actor-y. That aside, it's really fun.
One of the best first-person beatemups out there.

I'm supposed to recommend here, but I'm not. Avoid this game, its just bad. I gave it a chance and beat it (only 2 hours long) and I wanted to like it, but I'm now annoyed because of it. The story makes absolutely no sense whatsoever and the voice actors sound like they weren't even trying. The Only thing this game has going for it is the art style because its a visually unique game and the fighting is decent, but even thats hampered by guns with awkward reloading and firing.

No. Just, no. Absolutely nothing in this game makes any damn sense. The most mind-boggling thing so far is how this has a rating of 85%.  The visuals are interesting, and the music reminds me of Diablo at times, but then that's about it. The voice acting is atrocious, the gameplay is severely lacking and repetative, and I'm not even sure if there's an actual story, despite their efforts.  There's only so much an indie or 'non A+++' game can get away with before you have to stop treating it like a child's kindergarten project, giving it A's for effort. The one time I thought the game was going to do something interesting, or reveal what the actual plot was about, and it just immediately shoehorns you into a boss fight - the same exact one that you've already done half way through the game. That's all that ever happens; cutscene, pointless fight. Cutscene, pointless fight. Do you get to do anything to advance the plot? Explore? Manage an inventory (re: choose what weapon to carry around with)? No. Every 'level' or whatever you want to call it will choose how you will start the fight, that means it will either take away anything you were carrying at the time, or give you a random weapon and make absolutely zero effort on explaining why this happens.  The majority of the game, you have a companion... but does she do anything to be even remotely helpful? No. During one of the boss fights that has no rhyme or reason (like much of the game), this character perches herself up on a vantage point with a rifle, and what does she do? SHOOTS THE CRABS SKUTTLING AROUND... I'M DEAD SERIOUS. All she ever does is gets up on a vantage point, and does virtually nothing. You can hear her shooting at times, but at what, I have no idea.  For the first hour or so, I kept asking myself... why did I get this game? And then, the question turned into: what the hell is this game even trying to do? I don't understand how or why this game has a sequel. I really don't. I forced myself to play through to see what the hub-bub was about, and was just as disappointed at the end as I was at the start. Easily the longest, least-deserving 3 1/2 hours of my life.  A game needs more than interesting visuals and a 'well, they tried' attitude to warrant being as popular and highly praised as this one is. Please avoid at all costs, even if that cost is $1.99. It's not worth it.

Other than the empty and nearly awful second part this is a really competent First-Person-fighting game in a colurfull and well-imagined world, offering various strange characters and a nice little story. Play it!
Smash everything with your FISTS! Also the environments are really nice to look at. Unique too.

The fighting is enjoyable , the story was intriguing until the very end , the game played worderfully on my laptop and of course the game's strange asthetic , design and ood creatures that inhabit this strange world (reminded me of sacrifice in a way). The game is on the short side but for what 5 pounds I would highly recommend and will definately pick up the sequel if it goes on sale.

The combat in this game is very interesting. Difficult at times, with an interesting story, I am highly anticipating the completion of the game. It came as part of a Humble Bundle I grabbed for $1, but I would recommend buying the game to anyone who likes a step away from the normal everyday game, and can enjoy an oddball title that easily keeps you interested the entire time.  I love hearing Father-Mother talk.
VIVA CHILE CTM!
Very intersting story.  Twisted world with interesting art style. Way better fight mechanics thatn Dark Messiah, even if they take some getting used to.  Worth it.

One you fix the FOV the combat is very meaty and satisfying. The voice acting sucks but that kind of adds to the charm. Still looks surprisingly good for a 7 year old source game.  Would recommend on sale, very odd.
bought it for 0,99€ rip my beard for 1,20€ :(( Release Date: 21 Apr, 2009
Weird ♥♥♥ shit yo.
Very weird music and visuals. Great combat. Only about 3 hours long though, although there is a challenge mode too. Maybe best to wait for a sale. Brilliant game overall

Though the campaign is short, and the game itself is a little wobbly with a high learning curve, I still very much enjoyed it and would recommend it to anyone with some money burning a hole in his/her pocket.
A trippy fighter with a Deep storyline and excellent gameplay 10/10

Fantastic game with a catchy soundtrack and surreal, weird, yet very engaging universe. The whole game is divided in around 20 little scenes, takes you about five hours. It's just the right length. The combat system is nicely done. There are only two big flaws with this game: it's a bit unoptimized (that's caused by the engine), and the voice acting falls short for the worst possible character: your sidekick.  Overall, it's one of the best indie games of 2009 and you should definitely play it.

This game has some of the most satisfying melee combat I've ever played. I might even say it's the best. If not the deepest, at least it was incredibly fun to beat the ♥♥♥♥ out of strange humanoid animal things in an environment reminiscent of surrealist painting.  The story is fairly interesting and serves as an oddly disjointed but ultimately satisfactory vehicle for the gameplay.   Zeno Clash pretty much plays like a classic beat-em-up, with wave-based combat, but in first person with minor shooting elements. If that at all sounds appealing, I highly recommend this game.

Regardless of some of the games shortcomings, this game is highly enjoyable with a very pleasurable 1st-person brawler experience makes for some very solid gameplay that is refreshing to enjoy.    I want to get right into things and talk about the combat first. The combat is fun and is surprisingly fluid. Probably one of my biggest issues with the combat system is the enemies invicible times. Enemies can always override your attacks but there's a lot of times when enemies will commit to a attack and are completely invincible. Making it so you take unncessary damage and it kind of ruins the flow of the game I found. Sometimes you can't even dodge their attack when executing a perfect dodge to counterattack. But overrall the combat is fair game.  In the combat you are either using your bare hands to beat the living snot out of your enemies in a awesome intense fashion, or you're picking their health off with a gun from afar.  The combat keeps it very simple with the controls but also makes for some intense fighting. It's really hard to explain how the combat controls work via text over doing a live commentary for example and talking about how they work in the game itself. But the game has a what I'd say fair learning curve with a stiff challenge you may not be prepared for in skill yet. But ultimately you'll learn how to conquer your foes even if it has you going back a chapter or two to do some training. Which really isn't that big of an issue since the fighting in this game is fun as heck. You'll give your old enemies the one-two-puncharoo and you'll pick up some knew combat techniques (skill specifically, the game locks some advanced combat early game. But all results in combat are based on your skill and use of the controls) and be trained enough to learn how to take out tougher enemies.   I liked the soundtrack, it wasn't perfect. But it was nice and I can remember a few specific tracks that fit my fancy. They fit the fighting scenarios well and they really helped you get into fights, I give them credit for making soundtracks that pumped me up some in a lot of these battles and levels.  The art directive was really strange, I wouldn't say it was memorable or enjoyable persay. But it was interesting to look at and look forward to for their next environments and people. Though I had an issue with the level designs. In the sense of the backgrounds. Everything a little above level eye sight which would be the middle of the screen was sickingly blurry. It was like this in pretty much every level. I had to keep my eyes on the ground and the middle of the screen or I felt sick.  The voice acting was poor in it's own right, but that doesn't really matter. Same with the story, the story was kind of weird and didn't really make any sense besides your were just running away from your home because of your actions. But the story and voice acting and art and some of the blurry vision in the levels really pale in how good the action in this game was.    I know I didn't do a good job at explaining the combat at all, i'd definitely suggest watching a video of it on youtube. But the action brawling in this game is really good fun. It was an experience I was happy to partake in and i'm glad I played this game.    I got this game through trading for it, for it was in a bundle. I heard the game was good and I gave it a try and i'm now here to tell you that is indeed the case. I'd suggest getting it price cut of at least above 5 bucks. Anything below that is just criminal. Though this game is priced at $9.99 or your regional equilivalent and I'd say this game is worth the full price. It's good and I can't say i'd feel bad if I dropped ten bucks on this game. Because even after beating the game there's a challenge mode in-which you beat the crap out of people for numerous amounts of floors and that's jolly good fun too.   So anyways, Zeno Clash. If you don't mind a game that is highly action-oriented and with great combat and that's very fast-paced and alive. Get this game, it's really enjoyable.    Anyways, thank you for reading my review. I hope you found it helpful for considering if you want to purchase this game or not, have a good one.

Looks interesting but descends into tedium, the story does not grab me, the action is walk a little bit fight, walk, fight without anything else happening.   With all of it's weirdness I thought I'd like this game but it is just tedious and boring. The fights started to feel like a chore very quickly and without anything of note between fights, I can't see any reason to play this game.
this game was made while the developers were drunk and high.... possible some other drugs aswell
Best game I have ever played 11/10

+the art style and graphics are so unique in this game +simple and fun combat +decent story -not the best voice acting -feels a bit clunky and the animations for some things are stiff  overall a very enjoyable expirence, giving it a 8/10.
6.5/10 TJBs
Awkward controls and inconsistent difficulty
Can't stop playing this game, ♥♥♥♥ is cash 1/10.
waste of time and money
Can't save and it's not really clear when the game autosaves... I've tried picking this up a few times now because the art style is really interesting, but it's so clunky. Voice acting is awful too.
Another crap waste of data.

When you think of 'First Person Brawler,' you might think 'Oh, that's actually a pretty good idea!' This game isn't the answer to that. If it had multiplayer, I could fully understand the appeal, but it doesn't even have multiplayer, all it has is a madly hard-to-follow story and interesting visuals. That's all it's merits. Sure it's in a nice niche of quick-time events that you just have to know when to do so, and it might take a fair bit of skill to really get good at it, but you don't have time for that. The entire game feels no different from Call of Duty in the way that along the story, you move forward and OOPS YOU CAN'T GO ANY FARTHER BECAUSE MONSTERS, and then it's just fight after fight, a cutscene that makes zero sense, rinse and repeat, and then the game's over; the only real difference being that in Zeno Clash the guns aren't even guns and your companion does nothing to help you even though she's probably capable. She just stares at you during your short-lived fights and makes no effort to actually drive the thing.  All in all, the game is too lacking to get a 'yes' from me.
wow this game is soo damn weird
Cool game, but can be painful to play.
This game isn't worth spending any money or time on. Crappy controls, worse story.
At first I thought this was daxter and jack but I was wrong.
Fun combat system. Twisted and somewhat dark storyline.

Pretty good game! Combat is difficult (even on easy) and the AI is fairly strong. The story is bizzare and confusing but short and sweet. I got this game for $1 and I'd definitely say I got my money's worth.

If you like weird-♥♥♥-shit..... this is your game. I lovved this game and I can't even explain why. I think the story actually tricked me into liking it... again cannot explain............... this game... so weird..... but yet so------good. I've never fanboyed waiting for a game sequel like I am for this. Zeno Clash 2 coming soon ^^ Basically you go around punching and shooting gangs of freaks and trying to figure your life out....as the child of a.... tranny. Just play it?
One of my favorite weird games, this first person brawler is almost entirely unique in its story and mechanics. It's a real gem, but I would skip the second game.
Great melee combat techniques and entertaining story
Kinda fun game where u shoot&punch the crap out of weird looking things. 6/10
Zeno Clash is a first person brawler. The game has a bizarre art style but the gameplay is fun. Zeno Clash isn't a long or a challenging game so it would be best to get this game cheap.
This game is like a strange dream, you dont exactly know whats going on, but you go with it anyway. And in the end, you get an experience that you dont forget, no matter how weird.
3 words; Pile of ♥♥♥♥♥.

Zeno Clash is a First Person Brawler, as hard as that sounds to believe. Each of the stages are set up as fights between you and enemies, all of which start off with a Street Fighter 'VS' screen. The game also features a couple of weapons, although they are usually used as utility to the actual fist fighting. The game does actually have a story, although I'm not even going to try to explain it. The artstyle is unique as well, combining tribal looks with a bit of smashed together 20th century sculpture. The game is short, but also features an optional tower mode where you have to fight floors of enemies and progress up without dying. If you like quirky indie games, you'll probably get a kick out of the few hours Zeno Clash offers.

1. Get high, visit strange fairy-tale-gone-wrong fever dream 2. Kickpunch people in the napper (also shoot them with the world's worst gun - thank ♥♥♥♥ those parts are few),  3. Learn surprising things about your extended family, and go home with a great lesson learned. I think?  This is fun for its weirdness and there's not a lot of First Person Brawlers out there. Also a testament to how a few good people from Chile can bend the Source engine to some interesting shapes.

One of the most unique experiences I have had in gaming. And that is what it is, an EXPERIENCE. With some truly bizarre and surreal character and world design, Zeno Clash is a unique and original game that is unlike any other game that I have experienced.  - The campaign ran me less than hours, so it's a short game. - Some of the voice acting is under-par, but the character designs and mysterious story is more than enough to make up for it. - The gameplay is competent. Nothing to write home about, but it was neat. The first-person melee combat took some getting used to, but you will catch on pretty quick.  It is an older game, but if you can catch it for under $10, I would recommend picking it up.

There are no words to properly describe how deeply bizzare this game is. The setting is outlandish, the story is walking the edge of complete insanity and the characters are probably the strangest albiet the most well imagined I've ever seen in a game.  That said, the brawler combat is quite fun and, although the play through is rather short it is a fun and memorable experience.   I'm really glad I played this game.
Awesome fighting style, very beautiful areas and has an amazing storyline!

Watching the game unfold before my eyes seriously makes me cringe. Its brutal and very hard hitting.  Its strange because shooting endless goons makes me feel the opposite...  I give it 8.9 basic human animal instincts out of 10
this game is wierd like i cant explain it but theres squirrel bombs, bird people, horned duck raptors, metamoq, ugly people, insane tribes, etc. its enjoyable
Nice Action FPS, if I can call it like that, kind of bizarre. I recommend it.
A brain fever materialized as a game. And I say this with the highest praise possible.

as a big fan of old school beat em ups and first person shooters this game was perfect ,and yet very irratating annoying frustrating non-fun situations littered all over , i lost my mouse due too anger . still good game i hope the sequel is much more fun.

I beat this game countless times trying to get the Street Fighter acheivement (bugged?) and not once did I get bored with each play through. Great gameplay/story and the best fps fighter I've ever played. Maybe 1 day I'll figure out what I was doing wrong and have at it again.

Ah, Zenozoik! How I love to wander your bizarro lands, taste your hallucinogenic sweat - and beat the crap out of your adorably crazy inhabitants.  Couple of hours to complete, possibly years of love and inspiration. Seriously, Zeno Clash simply breathes creativity. Like your favourite choice of stimulant it invades your imagination and has you craving for more...but without all the unfortunate side-effects!  Notice also that it is an astonishingly fun 1st-person beat'em up - haven't seen many of those around.  +Style: Interactive Art! +Soul: Would go on vacation there. Also I am kinda in love with Deadra. +Fun: Buddy and Terry in Wonderland. -Content: Doing well but not doing much.

I ♥♥♥♥ing love this game. Everything about it is illogical, yet at the same time everything makes sense in a strange way. The combat is fantastic and I've never seen hand-to-hand combat done as well as Zeno Clash does it. This in itself is really impressive since first person melee combat is almost impossible to nail right. The story is very interesting as well. The game is really short but very sweet at the same time. Keep up the weird ♥♥♥♥ ACE.
A strange, deformed gem that everyone owes themselves to play through, just for that one of a kind bizzare experience no other game has given me.
One of the most surreal fighting games you will ever play! Quite insane...
Has great story, the characters are wierd. Pretty good fps melee game. The combat system is a bit frustrating. 9/10

Zeno Clash is one of those fantastic little indie games that is short, innovative, and a blast to play! The game is only 3-4 hours and you can choose which to play over sections you beat which is a nice touch. The game itself is a first person brawler with some first person shooting to mix up the action. The Brawling is fantastic and fun allowing u to dodge, block and counter attack, along with 3 other power types of attacks and has a combo system as well. The shooting works well enough with 4 different types of guns and doesn’t feel broken because you are disarmed by being hit as well as your opponents. The story is weird yet intriguing like no other game out there. It will keep you hooked till the end and will make you want more. Overall if you are interested in a strange game with fun game play give this one a try.
One epic game, recommended if you love to see unusal gameplay and design from time to time. While the weapons are fun, its the fist-fighting combat system that really shines :D

Only thing bad about this game is the combat can be hard and tedius(doesn all games have something like that?) and the range combat kind of suck but the story and setting/enviroment is awesome! worth the time just to experience this story.

Excellent game that combines the good plot, thinking, strategy, weapons and combat.  The plot of the game's hard to explain. The game is a first-person game which makes a great gaming experience and feeling great, the only problem I found in this game is very game but very short.  There is another option to play it a challenge mode, so far I have not tried it why can not express my opinion on it. The game is definitely worth $ 10, but just wait a discount. 8.3/10
Punch mentally deficient furries in the face. Then knee them (also in the face).

beautiful and twisted. creepy and colorful. ign compared it to an incan fever dream. the game is mostly a series of first person melee fights... i really didnt think i would be a fan. but play the demo and youll see. theres a good story, the characters are phenomenal, and the fighting doesnt feel repetative. so youre wondering why its only $15 well its short. multiplayer would have been real cool. there is some challenge mode but i cant imagine it adds much more

Ok I know what you are thinking the images make the game look lets say different.... Different in all the right ways I want to tell you a hiddem gem 77 is an underscore just because its not very long. The game really looks beautiful great job on the level and people designs. They are not the same run of the mill looks you see in most games they put thought and creativity into it.   Action is fast paced and fun I mean I cant remember playing a game where the weapons can be knocked out of your hand and you then fight bare handed. Bare handed is done perfectly to with everything you want fatigue, blocking, dodging and power punching to break the enemy's blocks. You can daze your opponent then throw them, knee them or uppercut them to the ground run over and kick them. You can also run over and throw an elbow. The only games with better fist fighting is fight night and UFC. The guns are pretty original and creative 5 of them then there is grenades and two melee weapons.   Seriously this is one of the best games I have played in a year really became addictive at points challenging but never frustrating. Had a weird but nice story not over played or dramatic with a really good ending. The only thing I can say bad its only about 5-6 hours But you get so much for what you pay for.

This game is just weirdly addicting. I enjoyed the art style, although very strange, and I thought that the combat was satisfying. Although it's fairly short, I was happy with the game over-all and it left me wanting to play the second game. The story is very weird and possibly off putting to some, (warning: you will fight the same people over and over, but in different circumstances and with new challenges added in) but it comes together in the end fairly well and can be challenging at times. Seeing as like only 5 guys made this game I was thoroughly impressed and glad that I played it. I'm looking forward to playing the second installment in the coming months. I got them both on a Humble Bundle sell and so far my money was definitely well spent.

Imagine if Dr.Seuss' muddle puddle tweetle poodle beetle noodle bottle paddle battle was real, and more like Thunder Dome from Mad Max.   Now you've got Zeno Clash.  It's a highly stylized first person brawler. It feels kind of odd to put that much detail and style into something that you don't look at while you punch everyone, but when you have time to stop to smell the blood spattered roses, it's a nice looking place. The story is a bit meh, and just goes so deep into this worlds bizzare lore that it gets a bit muddled. Really it's just for playing through once and going 'well that was interesting', then never touching it again.  Lets hope Zeno Clash 2 is better.  On the other hand, if Zeno Clash 2 is set in the same world, maybe playing this just to get into the lore would be a good idea.

Short, but a sweet experience. Unique first person hand to hand combat experience, a truely alien world, a nice mystery in the story and nicely varied experience all in all. Can be beaten in just a few hours, but those are hours well remembered and there are a few challenges to be taken when you're done with the story and want more of that sweet combat experience.

This is the greatest independent studio game EVER. if your a fan of old school beat em ups and want to spin kick, and punch combo's in first person in a very Tim Burton world along iwth some interesting guns like the Fishtols, then grab it. You won't regret it the challenge mode will keep you hooked even after a few play throughs of the single player. MY only issue is after the three new challenge levels all my Original Challenge data got erased which included my fastest speed in the world on Tower #1.

This game's unique and fantastic art design combined with its fun (but far from perfect) combat mechanics make for a very interesting gameplay experience. Even if you happen to dislike gameplay, it's still worth it just to appreciate the brilliant artistic design.
Utterly bizarre and incredibly captivating. The fight mechanics are clean and pretty easy to pick up, and the graphics design is unlike anything I've ever seen before.

This is one of the weirdest games I've ever played. From a trailer it may litle bit look like a open world FPS/RPG but in fact no genre is applicable for this game. Shooting is terrible, fighting can be frustrating, it's unbeliavably linear, movement is horrible (you can't jump or walk up the hill) and so on and on and on. Lot's of unresolved issues. Why the reccomendation? Well as I've said at the beginning. This game is weird and that's why I just love it. World is absolutely amazing and creative as well as creatures so even you can't really explore areas as you would like to do it can still be breathtaking at few moments. Especially if you're paying attention to the story which is very important and catchy. To sum up. Terrible game with great storytelling and absolutely amazing bizzare world. You will love it or hate it.

Crazy, but interesting, game. It's a first-person fighter, really. There are sometimes guns that you can pick up and use, but they are something you'll probably pick up, shoot, then toss instead of reloading. The world is bizarre and wonderful to be in. The story itself is quite intersting. And, of course, the art of everything in this game is just so amazing. It's just a really fun, out-there kind of game. Note that it can be difficult sometimes, and you'll really need to learn how to block and counter moves if you want to succeed.   tl;dr Good game. Buy it.
Simple, funny, sad, philosophical, strange and beautiful, really amazing.

If you like great stories, and crazy art.. then this is a must buy! I had lots of fun with it. One of those games that you just can't wait to finish to see the ending (when you actually start understanding what's going on... like after 15 minutes in)
I love this combat, the universe, graphics, story and everything! Great game with great price - must buy.
Beautiful, strange, crazy world. Creative storyline and flexible combat. A very very great game!!!

A creative storyline that keeps you interested with the most interesting fighting mechanics I've seen. It's basically it's own genre of game by being a First Person Fighting game. Easy and fun to play.

I don't even know how to describe this. Its weirdness, unique world setting, and terrible voice-acting all sort of give you this charming modern take on river city rampage meets mike tyson's punch-out. Its a graphically rich head-trip. (8/10)
Bonkers game. Cool art direction, weird as hell story, fun gameplay. Recommended.
Basically it's Fightin' Around the World: you randomly beating people up, as if you were Russell Crowe :D
Pros: Clashes were numerous Cons: Could use more clashes  Recomendation: MORE CLASHES

Zeno Clash is one of those games that you never see, i'm not talking about the story or the graphics or stuff like that, no; i'm speaking of it's originalility, throughout the course of the game, you can tell that practically all of the game was stuff thought directly from the top of the developer's minds, many games should take inspiration from such a game like this, it was hard to decide whether to be in awe or in complete disarray of what you saw in this game.
Crazy imaginative world, The first person fighting worked relatively well 1v1 but, become a pain when attacked by groups forcing you to fall back on kiting and doing low damage with guns.

A very fun and original game. Bought it for 3.75 and well worth it uses the source engine in a different way. Don't be fooled by the less than perfect AI or voice acting but the game is very enjoyable.
This game is interesting. Difficult too. Worth checking out if you catch it during a sale.

Zeno Clash is good because it's interesting, and not because it's particularly well made. It doesn't prooperlysupport controllers without some config file tweaking and even then you need a mouse to load your save. The easy difficulty can get pretty hard and autosaves can put you in a tough spot (fortunately, there's two so you can go back a bit further).   The combat is interesting, although I found it hard to dodge because it's a two-action sequence (block and then move) instead of a chord or single button. For controller users, there's no auto-aim for ranged weapons, I couldn't get the sensitivity low enough for precise aiming, and the reticle is hard to see so shooting can be difficult.  There's other minor things that feel unpolished like delays after finishing a fight where nothing happens and the bad voice acting of the main character, but I still like Zeno Clash because it feels so different. Your companion's voice acting is great, many of the other characters are good, the mix of melee and ranged combat works well enough, the world is beautiful and strange, and the struggle of the protagonist (while not sold through the acting) is interesting and isn't the standards save-the-world cliche.  I finished the game on easy with a controller, but used buddha mode (through the console) to get through some tough battles (like the infuriating Hunter).

This was actually a surprisingly good game. Its a bit weird in its setting and characrters, but the combat was fantastic and the story was surprisingly well done for a fighting game. Personally, I enjoyed the creativity that went into the world and character design but it may not be for everyone. An interesting sidenote is that it is built on Valve's Source Engine, which means the graphics have aged very well and it is moddable. Overall, I highly recommend it if you want a well made beat-em-up. 7-10 Stars
I put about 20 hours into this one. If you enjoy melee builds in Skyrim or Fallout you'll probably enjoy Zeno. The story is as weird as it looks.

A brutal, punkish, insane fantasy world awaits you in Zeno Clash.  This is a crazy world, where they use animals for weapons, bizarre creatures walk and talk around you, and nobody owns a ♥♥♥♥ing comb.  It also has some of the most brutal and visceral hand-to-hand combat I've ever experienced in a game.  In this game you play a man banished from his family, return to confront his progenitor, only to be thrust into a situation which forces him to fight for his life.   In his quest he faces his malformed brethren, the insane denizens of the nearby forest, and abominations from a time long past.    The game is held back in a few points, the voice-acting is a bit wonky, most likely due to the fact that none of the voice actors are native english speakers, but this is easy to ignore due to how ♥♥♥♥ING BIZARRE all the characters are anyway.  The thing that makes this game is the combat, it is intense. No. Really.  Give it a try. It's a helluva ride.
Absolutely incredible art direction, clunky gameplay and mediocre story. It's one hell of a fun romp just to see the sights.
It's unique and worth a playthrough.

A short but really unique first person, action, beat'em up game. Don't expect a very complicated and twisted story line, its pretty much linear and predictable. But game controls are the part makes it unique. Also I am attached to the artwork pretty much, even that its not AAA quality, it really gives you the feeling to be in that world. And challenges, don't forget them too!
Fun game, great value, and it can be verey challenging. ENJOY
If you like getting the ♥♥♥♥ beat out of you, or punching mentally unstable people, or even kicking the ♥♥♥♥ out of disease ridden chickens then you should at least play this game.

The main thing that I've taken from this game is an unwarranted desire to punch every parrot I see.  Zeno Clash is a super-funky post-post-Apocalyptic first person fighter that looks like it came out of the Jim Henson studio. If you can get it on sale, get it on sale. It's particularly short, and it doesn't blaze any new trails, but the trails it follows are memorable and colorful. It's Psychonauts strange, if not Psychonauts well-written.
Had potential but both gameplay and story isnt polished enough. Probably worth playing if u can get it on sale.

Super strange game about punching weird creatures in the face.  Good: Gameplay Setting Characters are creative Fighting feels very good  Bad: Voice acting Frustrating lock-on system Story is a bit hard to understand Your eyes are actually binoculars  Verdict:  Very cool first person fighting game in a crazy setting. 7.6/10
Played this during a weekend when I lost internet access. It's amazing!
very strange and twisted everything but in a good way :) graphic is porbably not that great today but everythin else made up for that :)

You can beat a fat cannibalistic pig man named Gaben like he ows you money. (is there something you'd like to admit ACE team?)  Seriously though, I love the David Cronenberg-esque aesthetics. The story is confusing, but it fits the wierdness of the aesthetics. The game is the first video game to make me feel like I'm in a fight. the hits are bone-crunching and very satisfying. There are very few FPS games like this. Makes great use of an old engine. It's funny, but my only criticism so far is that the shooting and aiming are not that great, wierd since it's the same engine Valve used to make Half-Life 2 and co.  I really recommend this game. I don't think there is a first person braweler like this except for the hand-to-hand combat in Morrowind.

This is a sad case of an interesting game that had no budget. The world was very interesting (even though the story was just OK and the character motivations were very...???), the gameplay ideas were different enough from the typical FPS, and the gameplay was fun enough for more than a distraction.  However, the voice acting was horrible, the character models and animations were awful, and there are SO MANY BUGS.  I really do recommend playing this through for something different: I was able to finish the entire story in just over three hours. I will likely get the sequel next time I see it on sale.

This game is weird, just so damn weird. I have fun playing it as the combat mechanics is new although I wont say spectacular. The characters, setting and soundtrack etc on the other hand are as I said above weird, it is as if someone created the game by joining pieces of his dreams together. I would recommend this game had it not been so buggy.,,,,and the bugs are too glaring to ignore. The hit detection is ridiculously absurd, enemies fall into planes where you cant reach them, the triggered events do not trigger ( twice in a row in a climatic part of the game)....and heck even the credits are buggy......Play this game only if you want something different but if you want a nice experience, I wouldnt recommend,.Plus it is short, my hours are due to me farming cards.
A game where you punch people, animals, pottery, and humanoid animal people hybrids. Theres also some gross weird complicated story attached but you can safely ingore it.

After the constant grind of games with top-end graphics it was kinda nice to pull back to something simpler and just give a good beat-down. The fighting part was almost like going back to Mike Tyson's 'Punch-Out'. The shooting, with simpler restrictions, was fun too.   I really enjoy this game :)

Weird in the extreme, but incredibly refreshing for it, sometimes laughibly easy and frustratingly difficult at other times, an exciting and challenging game that features some brutal hand to hand combat.
When your biggest complaint about a game is that its too short, you know you've got a good game.
What a game oh my oh yes
This game is super weird, but damn if it isn't bloody fantastic.

It´s a indie game, it should say it all, I mean it was very interesting and bizarre experience, but I would not pay more than 5 euros for that, it was too short, and gameplay a bit too clumsy, and the storyline was very messy, but well the design of the gameworld is nothing you see in any other games, its unique game but way too clumsy to really enjoy the bizarre world in it. Still worth to play it trough, but it doesnt deserve more than 5 euros!

Very short game, but worth the trip (pun intended). Very surreal visuals all around. The brawling mechanics are strange at first, but you get the hang of it. Defintely designed by someone who could think of things that never were, which is unfortunately a rarity.
Unique atmosphere. Interesting story. Solid game with few shortcomings.
